clinical_study.brief_title: Non-Immunoglobulin E-mediated Food Allergies in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Natural History and Pathophysiological Mechanism of Non-Immunoglobulin E Food Allergies in Pediatric Age

brief_summary.textblock:
Non-IgE mediated gastrointestinal food allergy (non-IgE-GIFA) is an evolving web of clinical conditions characterized by subacute and/or chronic symptoms and include food protein-induced enterocolitis syndrome (FPIES), food protein-induced enteropathy (FPE), food protein-induced allergic proctocolitis (FPIAP), and food protein-induced allergic dysmotility disorders (gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), colic and constipation) (FPIMD).
Despite the epidemiological relevance, pathogenesis, best diagnostic and therapeutic approach, and natural history of these disorders are poorly characterized. These limitations are responsible for delay and mistake in the clinical management. We aims to evaluate clinical history and pathophysiological mechanisms of non-IgE-GIFA in pediatric age.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- subjects aged between 4-72 months
- suggestive history of food allergy
Exclusion Criteria:
- age <4 or >72 months,
- chronic systemic diseases,
- malignancy,
- immunodeficiency,
- chronic infectious,
- autoimmune diseases,
- chronic inflammatory bowel diseases,
- celiac disease,
- metabolic diseases,
- cystic fibrosis,
- chronic pulmonary diseases,
- gastrointestinal and/or respiratory tract and/or cardiovascular malformations,
- neurologic and/or neuropsychiatric disorders,
- obesity,
- gastrointestinal tract eosinophilic disorders,
- other allergic diseases other than food allergies,
- administration of immunomodulating or corticosteroids treatment during the 4 weeks before enrollment.
